'''Google, Inc''' {{nasdaq|GOOG}}, is a [[United States|U.S.]] public corporation, initially established as a privately-held corporation in [[1998]], that designed and managed the Internet [[Google search]] engine. Google's corporate headquarters is at the "[[Googleplex]]" in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]], [[California]] and employs over 4,000 workers. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Dr. Eric Schmidt]], former [[CEO]] of [[Novell]], was named the Chief Executive Officer when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down. The company's overview web page states "Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful." The company has especially stayed in the news since September even more than before surrounding both major announcements and major controversies ( See below)
+
'''Google, Inc''' {{nasdaq|GOOG}}, is a [[United States|U.S.]] public corporation, initially established as a privately-held corporation in [[1998]], that designed and managed the Internet [[Google search]] engine. Google's corporate headquarters is at the "[[Googleplex]]" in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]], [[California]] and employs over 4,000 workers. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Dr. Eric Schmidt]], former [[CEO]] of [[Novell]], was named the Chief Executive Officer when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down. The company's overview web page states "Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful." The company has especially stayed in the news since September even more than before surrounding both major announcements and controversies.
==History==
==History==
===Beginnings===
===Beginnings===
Line 199: Line 199:

* Aug 2005: Google acquires [http://www.Android.com Android Inc.], a software provider for mobile devices [http://www.businessweek.com/technology/content/aug2005/tc20050817_0949_tc024.htm]
â
* Sep 2005: Google raises $4 billion in follow-on stock offering
+
==Major Announcements=
  +   +
September 2005
  +   +
Google raised $4 billion in follow-on stock offering, which led to many speculations regarding what the search engine company planned to do with the newly raised cash. Google already had $7 billion in cash prior to the stock offering making a total cash reserve of $11 billion.
* September 28: both Google and [[Ames Research Center]] disclosed details to a long-term research partnership. In addition to pooling engineering talent, Google plans to build a 1-million square foot facility on the ARC campus.[http://www.nasa.gov/centers/ames/news/releases/2005/05_50AR.html]
* September 28: both Google and [[Ames Research Center]] disclosed details to a long-term research partnership. In addition to pooling engineering talent, Google plans to build a 1-million square foot facility on the ARC campus.[http://www.nasa.gov/centers/ames/news/releases/2005/05_50AR.html]
